definition: secondary/auxiliary/deputy/assistant/vice-/abbr. for 副詞|副词 adverb/classifier for pairs, sets of things & facial expressions
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: The adverb of mood is of a sub-category in mod ern Chinese adverbial wo rds.
sentences.chinese: 語氣副詞是現代漢語副詞的一個次類。

sentences.english: The adverb of mood is of a sub-category in mod ern Chinese adverbial wo rds.
sentences.chinese: 語氣副詞是現代漢語副詞的一個次類。

sentences.english: To grasp the usage of adjectives and adverbs.
sentences.chinese: 掌握形容詞和副詞的用法。

sentences.english: An adverb of manner tells us how an action is done.
sentences.chinese: 狀態副詞告訴我們一個動作是如何進行的。

sentences.english: Chapter 3 A semantic and pragmatic analysis on the tone adverb Lian.
sentences.chinese: 語氣副詞“連”的語義和語用分析。

sentences.english: "Baibai" is an adverb, meaning to spend time or energy in vain or for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 副詞，指花費的時間或者是精力沒有意義，沒有效果。

sentences.english: Adverbs are always used to qualify verbs.
sentences.chinese: 副詞通常用來修飾動詞。

sentences.english: The two word-building is an important means of polysyllabic adverbs in Song Shu.
sentences.chinese: 這兩種構詞法是《宋書》中副詞複音化的重要手段。

sentences.english: Learn some words about places some prep. and adv. How to give directions.
sentences.chinese: 學習地點的一些單詞，介詞和副詞，如何指路。

sentences.english: The third part is a semantic analysis of the adverbial words with special purpose in denying structures.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分是否定性結構專用副詞的語義分析。

sentences.english: Monosyllabic adverbs in modern Chinese can be reduplicated.
sentences.chinese: 現代漢語單音節副詞可以重疊。

sentences.english: Adverbs of time provide information on when something happens.
sentences.chinese: 時間副詞用來表示事情發生的時間。

sentences.english: "Yishi" as an adverb of time has three types of grammatical meaning.
sentences.chinese: 時間副詞“一時”細分爲三類語法意義。

sentences.english: All of these above are gradable and can be modified.
sentences.chinese: 它們都具有程度性，可以受程度副詞修飾。

definition: part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
reading or phonetic value of a character
